title: Dive Package Configuration
content:
Dive Package Configuration

Dive packages are the core offering of your dive business. This system allows you to configure comprehensive dive packages with flexible pricing and inclusions.

Package Types

Standard Packages

  • 2-Tank Morning Dive - Most popular option
  • 3-Tank Full Day - For experienced divers
  • Night Dive - Specialized evening dives
  • Shore Dive - Beach entry options
  • Course Dives - Training and certification dives

Premium Packages

  • Private Guide - One-on-one diving experience
  • Photography Package - Underwater photo/video service
  • Specialty Dives - Wreck, deep, or specialty diving
  • Marine Life Tours - Focused on specific species
  • Technical Dives - Advanced certification required

Configuring Dive Packages

Basic Package Setup

  1. Navigate to Dive Packages from the main menu
  2. Click "Add New Package"
  3. Enter package details:
    • Package Name - Clear, descriptive title
    • Description - What's included and expectations
    • Duration - Half day, full day, multiple days
    • Difficulty Level - Beginner, intermediate, advanced
    • Certification Required - Minimum certification level

Pricing Configuration

  1. Base Price - Standard rate per person
  2. Group Discounts - Tiered pricing for groups:
    • 1-4 divers: Standard rate
    • 5-8 divers: 10% discount
    • 9+ divers: 15% discount
  3. Seasonal Adjustments:
    • High season (Dec-Apr): +20%
    • Low season (May-Nov): Standard rate
  4. Add-on Services:
    • Equipment rental: $25/day
    • Private guide: +$100/dive
    • Photography: +$150/dive

Inclusions Configuration

For each package, specify what's included:

  • Dive Equipment - Tanks, weights, BCD, regulator
  • Safety Gear - Surface marker, whistle, dive computer
  • Services - Guide, boat captain, deckhand
  • Refreshments - Water, fruit, snacks
  • Transportation - Hotel pickup/dropoff

Advanced Package Features

Dynamic Pricing

Configure automatic price adjustments based on:

  • Fuel Costs - Adjust for current fuel prices
  • Marine Park Fees - Include government fees
  • Seasonal Demand - Peak vs. off-peak pricing
  • Group Size - Volume discounts

Capacity Management

Set limits for each package:

  • Maximum Divers - Per guide: 4-6 divers
  • Boat Capacity - Maximum per boat: 12-20 divers
  • Site Restrictions - Some sites have diver limits
  • Equipment Availability - Ensure enough gear

Booking Rules

Configure booking restrictions:

  • Minimum Booking Time - 24 hours in advance
  • Cancellation Policy - 48 hours for full refund
  • Weather Policy - Dives cancelled due to weather
  • Minimum Divers - Some packages require minimum group size

Integration with Other Systems

Contract System

  • Automatic Pricing - Contracts pull current package rates
  • Availability Check - Verify capacity before booking
  • Package Upgrades - Offer premium options during booking
  • Discount Application - Apply group discounts automatically

Dive Operations

  • Schedule Planning - Package types guide boat assignments
  • Guide Allocation - Match guides to package difficulty
  • Equipment Preparation - Pre-stage gear for specific packages
  • Site Selection - Choose appropriate dive sites

Maintenance Tracking

  • Equipment Usage - Track gear usage by package type
  • Service Scheduling - Schedule maintenance based on usage
  • Replacement Planning - Plan equipment replacement
  • Cost Analysis - Track true cost per package

Package Performance Analytics

Revenue Tracking

Monitor package performance:

  • Most Popular Packages - Bookings by package type
  • Revenue per Package - Total and average revenue
  • Profit Margins - Calculate true profitability
  • Seasonal Trends - Package popularity by season

Customer Satisfaction

Track customer feedback:

  • Package Ratings - Customer satisfaction scores
  • Repeat Bookings - Customers booking same packages
  • Referral Rates - Package-driven referrals
  • Complaint Analysis - Common issues by package type

Operational Efficiency

Analyze operational metrics:

  • Guide Utilization - Efficiency per package type
  • Boat Usage - Capacity utilization rates
  • Equipment Turnaround - Gear preparation time
  • Site Success Rates - Dives completed as planned

Best Practices

Package Design

  1. Customer Focus - Design packages around customer needs
  2. Clear Inclusions - Be explicit about what's included
  3. Realistic Pricing - Ensure profitability while remaining competitive
  4. Flexible Options - Allow customization and upgrades

Pricing Strategy

  1. Market Research - Know competitor pricing
  2. Cost Analysis - Understand true costs per dive
  3. Value Proposition - Justify premium pricing with value
  4. Dynamic Adjustment - Regular review and adjustment

Operational Planning

  1. Capacity Planning - Ensure resources match package offerings
  2. Staff Training - Train guides on package specifics
  3. Equipment Management - Maintain appropriate gear inventory
  4. Contingency Planning - Backup plans for weather/equipment issues

Troubleshooting

Common Issues

  • Pricing Errors - Check discount calculations and seasonal rates
  • Availability Conflicts - Verify capacity settings
  • Configuration Problems - Review package setup steps
  • Integration Issues - Check connections to other systems

Performance Problems

  • Low Booking Rates - Review pricing and package descriptions
  • High Cancellation - Analyze package value proposition
  • Customer Complaints - Review inclusions and expectations
  • Operational Delays - Check capacity and resource allocation
